intro: Rubus lambertianus var. paykouangensis, commonly known as the Paykouangensis blackberry, is a variant of the Lambert blackberry native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
